file_content.text: The Diplomatic Service offers its most gracious thanks for your assistance.
My registry indicates you are the Emperor's Wrath. It pains me that my inferior design prevents me from prostrating myself.
My humble programming cannot calculate the sum pleasure of serving a lord of the Dark Council.
I must apologize that my lexical archives lack an honorific sufficient for a bounty hunter of your credentials.
Forgive my familiarity, but my restraining bolt cannot contain my eagerness to address the Empire's superlative intelligence agent.
In fact, my circuits are overwhelmed to be in the presence of such august figures.
Pardon me, organic superior, I must trouble you for a moment of your time.
I am in the employ of the Imperial Diplomatic Service. My masters have urgent need of you.
Diplomacy is for the weak. I speak, others obey.
I'm not big on negotiation.
That is exactly why the ambassador needs you, my lord.
My concerns span the Empire. Petty bureaucracies are beneath me.
Your masters are nothing.
This matter concerns our Empire's most important ally, my lord, which is why the ambassador seeks your intervention.
Your masters are not one of my preferred employers.
You people are too touchy.
The ambassador promises more flexibility than you had on Voss. This should be a situation you're quite familiar with.
Your masters have something they need handled discreetly?
Fill me in, and I'll consider.
Absolutely, sir. The ambassador said no one in the Empire has more experience influencing Hutt politics.
How may I assist the Diplomatic Service?
I'm ready to serve.
My masters have a bit of a crisis on their hands.
We're waging war in over a hundred systems. The time for negotiating has long passed.
Diplomacy seems pointless now.
When it comes to the Empire these days, I don't see a lot of talking going on.
They can't be busy right now.
With the burden of maintaining the Treaty of Coruscant alleviated, we're able to focus on more rewarding endeavors. Alliances, first and foremost.
Our relations with the Hutt Cartel have taken a sudden turn for the worse, and Ambassador Rove believes it'll take more than talk to salvage the situation.
Each of you has had extensive dealings with the Hutt Cartel; your combined expertise will certainly turn things around!
We'll put an end to this petty squabble, one way or another.
You'll get a resolution.
Bring us up to speed.
You've had extensive dealings with the Hutt Cartel, and your presence will show how serious we are about settling this dispute!
The Hutts often forget that wealth is not the same as power. I will remind them.
They won't trifle with me.
Very well. I'll represent the Dark Council in this matter.
I have influence in excess.
I can always make time to put the Hutts in their place.
This should be entertaining.
I'll have the Hutts eating out of my hand--or choking on it.
That's what I do best.
Ambassador Rove will be thrilled to hear your enthusiasm.
You said this was urgent. When do I meet Rove?
I'll talk to the ambassador.
How did the Empire get into this position and what does the ambassador plan to do about it?
What dispute, exactly?
For security reasons, those details were not transferred to my memory core. Ambassador Rove will be able to tell you more.
He awaits you on his diplomatic vessel. Please see him at your nearest convenience.
I do hope my technicians overlook this momentous occasion during my next memory wipe!
Always a pleasure to be in such notable company.
